jobTitle: High School Teacher - Math or Science - 1 yr in China
jobDescription: Our partner school, Saint Raphael Academy in Rhode Island, is seeking a career-oriented teacher for 1 year to serve as a Science or Math Teacher for the Qingdao Grand International School in Qingdao, Shandong Province. The right candidate will have the ability to combine their western expertise with Chinese culture to present the best of both worlds for the students.Weekday schedule is Monday – Friday, 8AM – 4:30PM. The compensation package begins at 22,500 RMB (~$3200 USD) per month, along with housing, and daily meal allocation. One round-trip flight and visa assistance will be part of the package.This position would begin on August 1, 2018 and end on June 30, 2019 and will report to the Director of Expatriated Teachers.Qingdao is located on the eastern coast of China and has a population of 9 million people.Key ResponsibilitiesCreate and deliver curriculum through lectures and classroom presentations to provide students with information about a variety of Science topics.Develop lesson plans and labs, assign homework, and test students on their understanding of the subject.Instruction may take place on a whole-class or small-group basis; some students may require individual help.Additional duties may include preparing students in grades 9-12 for standardized tests or supervising extracurricular or out-of-class activities.Ensure that all lessons are planned with clear aims and objectives and are delivered in line with the departmental scope of work and school policies.Requirements:Teaching certification/licensure from an accredited institution within the United States of AmericaBA or BS degree and a minimum of three years of teaching experience is required, degree in science education preferredAn advanced degree and/or record of multiple continuous years of successful high school classroom teaching experience is preferredAbility to speak and write in standard English at the post-baccalaureate levelAbility to interact, engage, and communicate effectively with high school students, faculty and administrationFamiliar with general science courses, laboratory and instrument uses in a school settingFluency with basic technology skills (Microsoft Office, telecommunications, multimedia creation) and a willingness to learn and use video-editing toolsEnthusiasm for student-centered instruction and creation of learning environment where learning and teaching fosters intellectual curiosity among studentsPositive attitude and appreciation for Chinese culture
